definition: 100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: Then he simply ignored this undertaking when it became inconvenient.
sentences.chinese: 但當這件事情不合時宜時，他選擇對它忽略不計。

sentences.english: The secret of remaining young is never to have an emotion that is unbecoming.
sentences.chinese: 永葆青春的祕訣就是決不要產生不合時宜的感情。

sentences.english: Then the dog will have to relearn who the boss is.
sentences.chinese: 那狗都不合時宜誰是老闆。

sentences.english: The middle of an election is no time to  face about.
sentences.chinese: 選舉中期改變主意是不合時宜的。

sentences.english: The secret of remaining young is never to have an emotion that is unbecoming .
sentences.chinese: 永葆青春的祕訣就是決不要產生不合時宜的感情。

sentences.english: The rift comes at a bad time for both countries.
sentences.chinese: 嫌隙發生的時間對兩國來說都不合時宜。

sentences.english: Don’t wear inappropriate clothing, chew gum, or show up late.
sentences.chinese: 不要穿不合時宜的衣服，嚼口香糖或是面試遲到。

sentences.english: Now their breezy confidence seems misplaced.
sentences.chinese: 現在他們的傲然自信似乎也不合時宜。

sentences.english: Vanish h'd unseasonably at shut of eve.
sentences.chinese: 這一切在黃昏不合時宜地消退。

sentences.english: I can discard that which is unfitting.
sentences.chinese: 我可以摒棄那些不合時宜的。

sentences.english: As he argues, the worn-out thinking and exhausted logic of the past have lost their relevance.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲，過去的思維和邏輯陳舊不堪，現已不合時宜。

sentences.english: It was a singularly inopportune moment to stage an anti-british demonstration .
sentences.chinese: 在這個時候發動一場反英示威是極不合時宜的。

sentences.english: It was a platform deeply shaken by her own untimely death.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這一綱領已被她自己不合時宜的死所深深動搖。

sentences.english: But the president’s referendum idea is equally cock-eyed.
sentences.chinese: 然而，總統先生關於公投的主意同樣不合時宜。

sentences.english: We looked at it carefully and we saw that it was just a mistimed tackle.
sentences.chinese: 我們仔細地看了，我們說這僅是一次不合時宜的剷球。

sentences.english: Therefore, how at present Microsoft does launch an attack looked that appears inopportune .
sentences.chinese: 所以，眼下微軟的“出擊”怎麼看都顯得不合時宜。

definition: frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
many and complicated/mired in minor details
